DOC.detailed_description: Background : Underdiagnosis undertreatment elderly person remain widespread problem . While many innovative geriatric care program exist within VHA , still lack systematic process identify at-risk elder large VA population likely benefit specialized geriatric service . Objectives : Our goal improve care at-risk old veteran comprehensive system casefinding , assessment , referral follow-up within primary care set . We hypothesize subject receive intervention complete evaluation treatment select geriatric condition ( i.e. , fall , urinary incontinence , functional status impairment , depression , cognitive deficit ) , good continuity care , less decline functional status , well general health subject receive usual care . Methods : This randomize controlled trial perform Sepulveda VA Outpatient Clinic . The study sample compose community-dwelling veteran age 65 old receiving VA geriatric service . Veterans mail health screen survey identify risk decline base criterion establish pilot work . At-risk respondent intervention group receive structure telephone assessment ( casefinding ) referral appropriate geriatric service , include geriatric assessment teach clinic integrate primary care , telephone case management . Subjects control group receive usual care . Major outcome measure collect telephone interview baseline , 12 , 24 , 36 month include functional status , self-rated health , satisfaction , health care utilization . Medical record review evidence evaluation treatment target condition . Status : Data collection project complete September 30 , 2001 . The subject recruitment phase complete August , 1998 . Collection 36 month follow-up data complete subject enrol . Data analysis preparation publication press .
